title: Chapter I - State Sanitary Code
content:
Chapter I - State Sanitary Code

State Regulations

Part 1 - General Provisions

Part 2 - Communicable Diseases

Part 3 - Repealed

Part 4 - PROTECTION AGAINST LEGIONELLA (Subpart 4.1 to 4.2)

Part 5 - Drinking Water Supplies (Subpart 5-1 to 5-6)

Part 6 - Swimming Pools, Bathing Beaches And Recreational Aquatic Spray Grounds (Subpart 6-1 to 6-3)

Part 7 - TEMPORARY RESIDENCES, MASS GATHERINGS AND CHILDREN'S CAMPS (Subpart 7-1 to 7-5)

Part 8 - Nuisances Which May Affect Life And Health (§ 8.1 to 8.6)

Part 9 - Prohibited Substances (Subpart 9-1 to 9-4)

Part 10 - Barber Shops And Beauty Parlors

Part 11 - Qualifications Of Public Health Personnel

Part 12 - Maternal And Child Health

Part 13 - Transportation Of Dead Bodies (§ 13.1 to 13.3)

Part 14 - Food Service Establishments (Subpart 14-1 to 14-5)

Part 15 - Migrant Farmworker Housing

Part 16 - Ionizing Radiation (§ 16.0)

Part 17 - Mobile Home Parks (§ 17.1 to 17.13)

Part 18 - Public Functions With Attendance Of Over 5,000 People (§ 18.1 to 18.20 to 18.25)

Part 19 - Clinical Laboratory Directors (§ 19.1 to 19.6)

Part 20 - Repealed

Part 21 - Repealed

Part 22 - Environmental Diseases (§ 22.1 to 22.12)

Part 23 - Sexually Transmissible Diseases (§ 23.1 to 23.5)

Part 24 - Acquired Immune Deficiency Syndrome (aids) (Subpart 24-1 to 24-3)

Part 25 - Repealed

Part 30 - Repealed

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
